column1: good length on middle, no swing, turns this nicely through forward square, the man in the deep runs around, they think about two but it's not on
sharp inswinger, good length, hits the pad, big appeal from Pant, but not much interest elsewhere, not out, going way down
good length outside off, mistimed drive runs slowly to mid off and they run an easy one as mid off is deep on the circle
crunched on the up through extra cover! Good length angling across but well wide and he throws the hands through this and picks the gap at extra cover. it races away
good length, middle and leg, tucked through square leg to the sweeper
good length, nipping back, hits him on the pad, big appeal, not out, outside the line, it runs to a vacant gully and they run a leg bye
125kph, beaten, good length nipping across, he prods forward and it goes past the edge, but it bounced short of Pant
129kph, cracking pull shot! Fractionally too short and Finch pounces, he thumped this so hard through midwicket. It thumped into the rope
swinging a touch down the leg side, he misses the glance, definitely a wide
127kph, good length outside off, he punches wide of mid off on the up, nicely timed, didn't overhit it, gets a couple
swinging way down leg, Finch is frustrated his head falls over but it's a wide and he gets another ball
good length, fourth stump line, punched to cover
129kph, driven nicely on the up straight to cover, Finch walked down the track, Kohli fired at the striker's end and hit, there's a review for run out. Finch got his bat back easily
short ball outside off, Finch tries to pull hard but is through the shot and gets a bottom edge that bounces to Pant
smashed down the ground straight over the umpire's head! This was 129kph in the slot and he pounded this flat and hard back at the sightscreen
half-volley outside off, driven with a check drive straight to cover
shorter length, of off stump, he stands up and defends back to the bowler
120kph, shorter length on off, he punches off the back foot to cover and Kohli makes a rolling save
133kph, good length across him outside off, gets a thick edge that flies along the ground to short third man
short into the hip, he pulls nicely but straight to the man in the deep on the rope on the bounce
short outside off, just enough width and he cuts beautifully past point! This wasn't that wide but he created the room and placed it perfectly
beaten trying to cut again. This was not as short and closer to off
slower ball, good length on off, he defends towards point and they pinch one on Rahul
141kph, good length outside off, he drives on the up to cover
139kph, good length angling into off, he works with the angle square of midwicket
139kph, very full, driven off the bottom of the bat and it rolls slowly to mid off and they run well
133kph, short into the thigh, he tried to whip, it runs off thigh just away into the leg side and they take an extra
135kph, short ball, and he pounces and hammers a pull shot through square leg! He got up with the bounce and rolled the wrists. Cracking shot
114kph slower ball, length, he swipes this cross bat high over midwicket, mis timed but it falls well safe and deep midwicket comes around
good length outside off, tried to loft over the off side, gets a thick inside edge onto pad, and it rolls into the off side for one
134kph, short ball, chest high and he smashes a pull shot straight to the fielder on the rop at deep square

driven magnificently wide of mid off! 117kph slower ball floated up outside off, he picked it, held his shape, and eased his hands through it, it was hit in the air but right in the gap between cover and mid off and flew to the rope
116kph, slower ball, bunted towards mid on
angled down leg and he tucks this with the angle down to fine leg
123kph, on the hip, he plays the pull with the one knee up, picks out the man at short fine but he misfields and allows a single
144kph, he defends a good length and pushes this to cover-point and they pinch a tight one, there is a shy from Krunal at the non-strikers but he was home
good length outside off, he drives on the up straight to cover
full toss and square driven past point! A rare mistake from Bumrah. This was a wide full toss and Short just had to place it past point and it flies to the fence
tries to sweep hit on the pad, huge appeal, not out. It was outside the line, not much turn
floated up, leg break, he skips down to the pinch and whips with the turn to deep midwicket
tossed up, 79kph, outside off, mistimes a drive to cover
slower, good length, he's down and pushing back to the bowler
wrong un, short outside off, he's back and crunching a cut shot, and Rahul misfields on the circle, they get two to the man in the deep
shorter, spinner way wide of off, he reaches to cut but misses, not called a wide, it was tight
dropped at long on! Toss up outside off, he launches this high and gets under it, it goes miles up, Rohit camps under it and drops it. He dropped with his hands below his waist
shorter on middle, he's back and tucking this through midwicket
shorter on middle and leg, 96kph, he's back and tucking this through square leg
shorter and pushed through outside off, cut hard to backward point and Bumrah misfields and it runs away for four! He should've stopped that. It just spun away from his hands
shorter length, he pulls hard to deep midwicket
backs away, it's darted into leg, but short enough, he cuts past point and it beats the man at deep cover running around!
tossed up outside off, he square drives hard to deep cover-point
this is spinning down leg, Pant can't glove it and they run another extra
top spinner, he tried to cut close to off, misses and Pant doesn't glove it again, it rolls away

top edged sweep caught at short fine! Krunal hangs on to this simple chance! This was a leg break on leg stump, he tries to sweep, a bit of extra bounce catches the top edge, it balloons to short fine and straight to Krunal, no chance he could drop that
pitching outside leg, spinning way down leg for a wide
shorter on middle and leg, he tries to give room but bunts it back to the bowler
wrong un, he drives and times this so well past cover! What a shot. It beats the man at deep long off

given out LBW! Maxwell reviews after a long discussion with Short. It pitches on middle, he tries to whip to leg, it beats the inside edge. Definitely no bat. Ball tracking says it pitched in line, and spinning down leg! Missing leg. Maxwell survives. Great review.

LBW! Again a long discussion and Short reviews! He tried to sweep, Krunal from around the wicket, it pitched in line, no bat involved. Ball tracking says it was in line, hit in line and was hitting! They lose the review this time. That was plumb.

LBW! Given out sweeping! He's on a hat-trick! First ball sweep shot, this was tossed up outside off from around the wicket, pitches outside, he tries to sweep, it slides on and hits the back leg, and Gerard Abood says it hit in line with off!
around the wicket, pitching on middle, he turns this with the spin to square leg
tossed up outside off, he pushes off the front foot to cover
shorter length, he's back and punching to long off
beaten this spins sharply past the edge as he drives
a tad short, making him reach outside the off stump. Carey chops it in front of point
loops it up onto off stump, Maxwell drives to extra cover
seems like a top spinner, going through flat on off stump and not spinning a great deal. Maxwell goes back, perhaps wondering if he can cut it, but then has to block down the pitch
good length, spinning into him, Maxwell tries to pull, but it doesn't rise as much as he wants
hits to long off. Probably picks the googly
loads up a big old sweep, dragging a tossed up ball from way outside off away to deep square leg
goes short, the ball rising up to his chest. Carey gets up on tiptoe and nudges it to short midwicket
looks for the clip through midwicket again, but he's underestimating Khaleel's bounce. In the end, the ball lobs off his thigh and into Khaleel's followthrough
helps the back of a length delivery on off stump away to deep square leg. Short-arm pull done right

top-edge! It can happen, with the left-armer's bouncer going across the right-hander, and him going hard at a ball rising above his shoulder. Not easy to get on top of it to muscle it through leg. But you do have every chance of pinging a boundary right behind you
goes for the pull, but here, Khaleel is able to sneak under the bat and through to the keeper
shortish and outside off, dabs it in front of point
seam-up delivery, I think, on a good length on off stump. And Maxwell knocks it back to long-on
that's beautiful work from Carey. Waits for the tossed up slower ball to arrive and then hits it smoothly over the field at cover.
quicker delivery, hoping to catch the batsman cutting just because the length is short. But Carey is alive to the threat it poses to the stumps and deflects the ball to point
reaches out in front of him to sweep a well tossed up delivery to deep square leg. Lovely variations in flight from Kuldeep
tries to make room to crash the ball through the covers, but Kuldeep follows him, and bowls so very slow too, refusing an antsy batsman any pace to work with
doesn't pick the googly this time as a good length ball on middle and leg spins away and takes the leading edge as he tries to flick it

taken at long-on! Maxwell clears his front leg and tries to launch the ball into orbit. And really, this ball is there to be hit, pitched short of a length and not even pretending as if it'd turn. The batsman makes room, hits as hard as he can, but he can't clear the straight field. Simple catch to Rohit, who makes up for the earlier drop
sweeps the fuller delivery outside off to deep midwicket
whips the flatter delivery on middle through midwicket
over cover! Insane timing. Carey does nothing more than extend his hands, and a straight bat. And the full toss outside off just disappears to the boundary
works it down to long-on, dragging it from outside off
good length on off stump, taps to point, and runs
back of a length and strays too far outside off for the umpire's liking
goes round the wicket for a length ball outside off, Lynn slides it away to deep point
full on off stump, Carey dinks it down the pitch and Khaleel doesn't let it go past him on his left
low full toss outside off, steers it to the boundary at cover. Simple timing again. Has a solid base. Keeps his eye on the ball. Plays as it's said in the text book
hacks away a back of a length delivery from outside off to deep midwicket
looks like the slower ball, banged into the middle of the pitch. The 118 kph delivery is pushed to extra cover
offcutter again, but in trying to play hide and seek with Lynn, he slants this ball way too wide outside off

gets into the pull shot a little too early and only gets a toe-end on this short ball outside off. Good over from the left-arm quick. Excellent plan to change the pace and pull his length back against the big-hitting Lynn. Denies him that big, baseball swing
full and outside off, Lynn drives to the left of long-off and pinches a second run
slips down leg as Lynn misses his sweep shot, the bat coming down a little too late to catch up with the ball
pushes the flatter delivery on leg stump to long-on
beautiful shot, over cover! The left-armer coming round the wicket drifts the ball across the left-hander. And he just plants his foot forward and extends the arms. Breathtaking clarity.
knows the bowler will go short and wicket to wicket, so he is ready with a reverse swat, taking the ball off middle stump and smuggling it to the third man boundary

finds deep midwicket! It's the tossed up delivery. It's on middle. It's there for the sweep shot and Carey's been timing them like nobody's business. Except here, as well as he hits it, he can only find Kohli on the boundary
nudges it through vacant square leg

takes the pace off and pitches it short as well. Stoinis can't adjust to the lack of pace. And he doesn't have any room to free the arms. Tries to flick, but it lobs off his body towards where silly point would have been
looks like a legcutter, which Lynn smashes it deep point. Stands tall and flat bats it with venom
back of a length on off stump, Stoinis gets an outside edge to point

lashes it to the point boundary. Decent plan to bowl slow at a hard-hitter of the ball. So too is the length - short on these big Aussie grounds can be useful - but there is too much room on it and Lynn takes full toll
targets the base of off stump, Lynn skews it away for a single at long-off
holds his shape, even though it seems like he only just picks the slower ball, and taps it to the right of Bhuvi for a single
back of a length and outside off, Stoinis punches to the sweeper

mix-up, direct hit, Lynn's gone. Oooh, this is silly, silly stuff. Stoinis starts it all by dabbing the ball gently towards point and wants a single. Lynn isn't keen on it at first but then just as he commits to it, Stoinis is haring back into his crease, leaving him no choice but to race back to the bowler's end. But Bumrah is on the balll, he takes aim and he throws down the stumps. Super stuff
another slower ball, the offcutter kicking up off the pitch and unsettling Stoinis, who nicks the ball almost onto his stumps
short and outside off, he slaps it to deep point
nails the yorker on middle and Coulter-Nile is awake to it's considerable threat. Single towards mid-on
slices the full toss on and around off stump to the point boundary
yorker on middle and leg, Coulter-Nile works it to deep midwicket
looks for the blockhole again, Coulter-Nile hits it down the ground to long-on
good length and outside off - but there's no pace in it. Stoinis blocks to point for a single
legcutter flies away off the outside edge. Tiny bit of room for Coulter-Nile to free the arms and he latches onto it well enough to get four over point
pin-point yorker on off stump and Coulter-Nile is only just able to dig it out
carves the length ball to the left of long-off. Bhuvi misses his mark and Coulter-Nile clears his front leg and sends it racing away across the SCG turf, singeing the grass
bouncer! Hoicks it away over midwicket! And then looks at the bottom of the bat! Honestly, if it travels the distance on an Aussie ground, that bat must be magic
sends it to long-on
slower ball outside off, Coulter-Nile prepares to flat bat it over the bowler's head but the lack of pace makes him drag it to long-on
back of a length slower ball targeting the wide line, Stoinis thumps it down the ground to long-off

heaves the short ball out to long-on! They want a second run. It's risky. Coulter-Nile dives. Has he made it? The third umpire needs to check this Yes! He has. And it's all because of a sensational dive! Full-length. Perfectly timed. And he gets to his crease in the time it takes for Bumrah to collect the ball and break the stumps
loses his shape as he goes for a slog and the dipping slower ball outside off wanders away to the keeper
goes for the pull, gets an inside edge, and slips away to the left of the diving fine leg fielder. Hm, 164 then, that's a pretty decent total all considered.
142kph, good length, hint of swing in to off, runs off the edge along the ground to third man
146kph, good length outside off, he tried to launch this with a cross bat, chops it off the bottom edge into the pitch
146kph, back of a length just outside, he waits and runs it off the open blade to third man
146kph, inswinging yorker, he jams the bat down and squeezes it behind square, just got the bat down in time!
142kph, bouncer, this flies very high, Dhawan sways under, it's not called wide
145kph, good length angled into middle, he works this with the angle to midwicket
angled down leg, he picks this up and flicks it up and over short fine! Great shot
full outswinger outside off, pitching on the popping crease, he slices it through the gully
138kph, good length into leg stump, cramping him, he works to square midwicket
125kph slower ball, good length on middle, he defends on the front foot to cover-point
good length outside off, he drags it off the bottom half of the bat to midwicket
steps back and across early and pulls behind square! Great batting, he moved early, created the shorter length and pulled it fine of the man at deep square
good length on off, he defends with soft hands close into the off side, and an easy one is run. Great batting
144kph, swinging wide of off, he flashes and misses but it's called wide by Paul Wilson
full into off, he drives inside out wide of mid off, Tye goes with the one hand and misfields, he allows a couple
145kph, back of a length into middle, he turns it with the angle to midwicket
145kph, tailing into the pads, full, he misses out trying to whip it away, it was going way down leg so no shout for LBW
139kph bouncer, he tries to pull hard but it comes off a touch slower than he expected
cracking off drive! This was a half-volley and he leaned into the drive and placed it perfectly past mid off
angled down the leg side and rightly called wide
short into the hip and he pulls with the angle up and over fine leg into the crowd! What a shot. Too easy for Sharma
137kph, good length, fourth stump, he defends with soft hands running into the gully
126kph, good length, middle and leg, he defends on the front foot
116kph, slower ball bouncer, he waits and pulls to deep square leg
slower ball, back of a length, he hammers a slog sweep over deep midwicket into the crowd again! Wow!
slower ball again and driven on the up straight of cover! Superb batting from Shikhar Dhawan. He has clobbered this on the rise into the gap
128kph, good length into leg stump, he turns neatly off the front foot to midwicket
crunch! A front foot pull over long on! Just a fraction short at 126kph, Rohit read it and flat batted this over long on and it goes all the way
127kph, good length on off, he turns with soft hands to square leg for a single
slower ball full toss that slipped out way wide. It didn't land on the pitch
launched over square leg way back into the stands! My goodness! Again he drops short on the hip and he massacres this pull shot and it goes way, way, way back into the crowd!
102kph slower ball, good length, he sits waits and slaps it back over the bowler's head, three bounces over the rope!

pulled over mid on and it lands just short of the rope! Wow! This was 129kph, short and way wide, he stands up and hammers a pull flat and straight over mid on. It was only metres short of another six!
129kph, good length slower ball on off, he defends with soft hands into the off side for a simple one
driven through cover! 128kph slower ball, half-volley, he picks it, waits and places this inside out past cover and it flies to the rope. What batting this is

full and straight, 145kph, into middle, did it hit pad before bat? Umpire says not out to the shout. Australia review. It was tailing in, definitely hit pad first. Ball tracking says it's hitting leg stump! Out LBW!. Great review from Finch. Great work from Starc
full angled across, he is cautious, playing a text book defensive push to cover
shorter length, on middle and leg, he jumps back in defence into cover
146kph, good length on leg, he works it to midwicket
tossed up leg break, very full, driven back to the bowler
shorter and wider, it skids on, he tries to late cut but misses
fired through, angled down leg, he tried to pull and slips over as it hits the pad. There's an appeal but it's not out
flipper, fired into off, he defends on the front foot

bowled him! This was fired in at 91kph, good length, Sharma played back and tried to work against the line through square leg, it skidded on off the surface, hurried him, inside edge onto pad and then onto the stumps!
tossed up outside off, he drives straight to cover
135kph, good length, he walks a pace down to the line and whips this sumptuously wide of mid on for two. What a way to get off the mark!
132kph, short ball, he's pulling but gets it off the toes of the bat and rolls it around to deep fine leg
136kph, good length, fourth stump line, checks a drive to cover
pulled over deep square! 132kph, back of a length, he picked up the length so quick, pulled it off the bottom of the bat but he hit it hard enough to sail high over the man in the deep at square leg!
pushed on the front foot slowly to mid off and they run well to pinch one
137kph, fuller length, he drives nicely to deep cover-point
85kph, around the wicket, drifting to middle, he defends on the front foot
shorter length on leg, he whips this nicely to deep square leg
he pushes this through to off, he's back and defending
shorter on leg, he's back and working through square leg to the sweeper
flighted slower and fuller, he drives straight to cover
95kph, good length on off, he's back and pushing this to midwicket
drifting outside leg, on the front foot he works this through square leg and Kohli immediately calls two, great running. He is so good at that
flighted outside off, a slog sweep flat along the ground to deep long on
fired full down leg, Carey can't glove the half-volley, they get another run on top
flatter outside off, deft late cut to fine short third man
wrong un, nicely pitched turning into off, he defends into the off side
shorter length on off, 92kph, he's back and pushing it to long on
short and wide and Kohli pounces, cuts this hard and places past point! Great stroke from Kohli
shuffles across with Maxwell going across him from round the wicket, and the good length ball on off stump is nudged through midwicket
leans forward as he get to the pitch of the offbreak on leg stump and works it through midwicket
goes for the reverse sweep, but with Maxwell pulling his length back, he's unable to make any contact
pushes it through on middle and leg, Rahul works it to the right of the bowler
tosses it up on off stump, Rahul knocks it back at the bowler, unable to find the single he wants
ticks it past the right of Maxwell, even with him diving full-length to his right
premeditates a reverse sweep and that allows the bowler to change his line, bowling onto leg stump to deny hitting room.
comes down the pitch but Zampa gets the ball to dip in time and Rahul can only push it down the pitch
whips it through midwicket
stays back in his crease against the googly, picking the variation, waiting for it to turn into him, and them flicks it sweetly to deep midwicket
gorgeous late cut but even still, it should only have been a single. Lynn at short third man mistimes his dive and gives away a couple more
thinks about coming down the pitch but Zampa's flat trajectory and his excellent line around off stump disallows Rahul any access to his power game. Single through cover off an ugly slice
shortish and outside off, from round the wicket, Rahul punches to cover
steps out to drive a length ball going across him to long-off
mis-hits it over point! Kohli is trying to make room, trying to one-up Maxwell who has been trying to deny that. The ball drifts away from him just enough to make him lose his shape
turns the length ball on middle through square leg
shortish and outside off, he stands tall and pulls it through midwicket

caught at long-off! He's been trying to dominate the spinners, trying to put them off their lengths by charging at them, or reverse sweeping them. But it never looked like coming off. And this time, he's even found the fielder. A trip down the pitch and a desperate slash is taken very very easily by Coulter-Nile

caught behind! This is poor. He needs pace to play a shot like this - the pull to the fine leg boundary - but that's the one thing Tye denies. The slower bouncer outside leg stump sneaks up on Pant, rising up at him, lobbing up off his glove and settling in Carey's waiting hands. Australia, without anyone noticing, are getting on a bit of a roll
good length on off stump, blocks to cover and runs
lbw appeal but the fuller delivery is slanted into the pads and would have slipped down past the stumps as DK misses the flick
back of a length on off stump, Karhik keeps it out
shortsh on middle and leg, they secure a single through midwicket
works it away straight of midwicket
picks the googly as he stays back and flicks the quicker delivery through midwicket
loops it up on middle, Karthik turns it to deep midwicket
goes wide of the crease to ensure the ball slants into Kohli, dipping at the last second to beat Kohli on the flick
short and outside off, Kohli pulls it to long-on
steps out but he ends up too close to the ball, yorking himself as he tries to drive to cover
Kohli yells at himself after he fails to make contact with a length ball wandering away down leg
comes down the pitch, only to inside edge the back of a length ball that denies him the room he wants
lashes it over point. Excellent work from Kohli, getting on top of the ball, waiting on it so he can get the gap behind point
times it perfectly - both the step down the pitch and the bat swing that comes down and goes straight through the line of the ball. Outstanding shot over long-off
slower ball, and that lack of pace is useful in deceiving Kohli, as he plays the flick and misses
back of a length and outside off, Kohli taps it behind point
opens the face against a length ball on off stump, but he finds point
full on middle, Kohli tucks it through midwicket
sweeps the loopy delivery on off stump away to backward square leg on the boundary
launches it over deep midwicket! Spectacular hit, coming down the track, and even though he isn't to the pitch of the ball, he holds his balance and that's where he gets all that power from
works it through midwicket, along the ground this time

run-out chance at the non-strikers. Karthik nudges it to the right of Maxwell and thinks there's a straightforward single there. But Maxwell hares across, grabs it with his right hand, takes aim, but misses the target
goes for the reverse scoop, and though he only makes contact with the glove, it's enough to get a couple right over the keeper's head
taps it into the vacant midwicket region, always looking for two, and getting it in the end
gets up with the short ball outside off and swats it to deep point
comes down the pitch and drives the full delivery tailing into him to mid-off
mis-hit behind square leg, but it brings up his fifty. The slower short ball has him playing a touch too early; reaching in front of him as he goes for the pull
so much height on it! And it's on the second tier. Mistake from the bowler, going short, the ball sitting up to be pulled to oblivion
appeal for a catch off the boot. But the umpire Abood says no. Decent ball though, tailing in late, cramping Kathik who was charging down the pitch again
hustles it away towards the deep midwicket boundary as Starc bowls a full one on off stump from round the wicket
141 kph, tries to whip a back of a length ball angled into his thighs, but he's into the shot a tiny bit early and the ball lobs off his thigh

spears it to the point boundary! It's not quite the yorker Starc is looking for outside off. But it is exactly what DK is ready for. Stays balanced at the crease. And more importantly, low, as well and opens the face of the bat. Lovely stuff
whip of the wrists sending the fuller delivery looking for the middle stump away through square leg
pulls the short ball from outside off to deep square leg
walks across outside off and ends up too far away from the short ball outside leg. In the end, he just about gets to it with a pull through square leg
beats him with a slower ball that Kohli swings across the line and misses completely
is that not a wide, asks Kohli, after he doesn't make contact with another short, slower ball outside off
thumps it down the ground. It's a half-volley, in Kohli's swinging arc, and he hammers it away. He's pumped. He's punching the air. He's sensing the series going level
swings it out to the vacant areas around midwicket and celebrates with arms aloft. India level the series
